ygData.subject: Proposing a new extractor called SmartExtractorHTML
ygData.msgSnippet: Hi all, I m interested in writing a new extractor, but I wanted to get peoples input first before I get started. Maybe this has already been done by someone,

Hi all,

I'm interested in writing a new extractor, but I wanted to get peo=
ples
input first before I get started. Maybe this has already been done by
=
someone, or this functionality can be done with Heritrix 2.0

Basically I w=
ant to modify ExtractorHTML so that it will only extract
URIs if the downlo=
aded HTML has been modified since the last time that
URI was crawled.

This=
 will be done by the SmartExtractorHTML generating an MD5 of the
HTML docum=
ent, and comparing this with an entry in a database for that
URI. If the tw=
o MD5's don't match, then it will extract all the URIs
otherwise it will pr=
oduce zero URIs.

To reduce the performance hit on the database. This extra=
ctor will
only check the database for known URIs. At the start up of the cr=
awl
it will remember all the URIs defined in the database, and only update
=
the database if the HTML has changed for that URI.

To handle the problem o=
f advertisements changing HTML content. The
crawl operator will be able to =
define regular expressions that will
first clean the HTML document, before =
generating the MD5. Maybe it
could also have regexp to define HTML blocks o=
f interest.

This extractor is designed for crawl operators who want to mon=
itor
known URIs for changes (such as news pages, message forums, document
m=
anagement sites, or wiki's).

Let the discussion begin :-)
